weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day unfolds beneath a heavy blanket of clouds, as rain falls steadily, drenching the streets and casting a muted gray over the landscape. With a high near sixty-two, the chill in the air will soon embrace a noticeable drop as the afternoon approaches, settling around fifty-eight. The wind, gusty and relentless, sweeps in from the south-southeast at a brisk fifteen to eighteen miles per hour, rattling branches and petals alike, a stark reminder of the tempest at hand. The soaking rain—that persistent drumming—promises to deliver between one and two inches, the kind of weather that transforms even the most vibrant city into a drizzly silhouette.

As evening weaves its way into the city, conditions will remain decidedly uninviting, with a low of fifty-two and winds shifting southwest yet continuing to howl. Seeking shelter is wise; a cozy afternoon inside seems preferable. Wrap yourself in layers; comfortable rain gear and sturdy footwear will serve you well against the relentless drizzle. Consider tucking into a local café, the warm aroma of coffee and fresh pastries beckoning. Perhaps a stroll along the waterfront, umbrella in hand, could even bring unexpected charm to the moody atmosphere, as the water reflects the city lights through a veil of rain. It’s a day that invites reflection and a little introspection—a reminder that sometimes beauty lies hidden beneath a somber sky.
